sentences: Argentina, for the G-77/CHINA, welcomed outcomes on several agenda items, including on the Nairobi work programme and on research and systematic observation.
She expressed disappointment at lack of agreement on a draft decision on response measures.
The EU welcomed progress on the Nairobi work programme and technology transfer, and indicated research dialogue and CCS in the CDM as areas for further work.
The Democratic Republic of Congo, for the AFRICAN GROUP, highlighted adaptation and response measures as key issues.

Grenada, for AOSIS, said efforts to mitigate climate change must meet the highest standards of environmental integrity and that Annex I parties should report on all gases with high global warming potential. SBSTA Chair Richard Muyungi thanked participants and closed SBSTA 35 at 11:23pm.
